result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Wartgow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Upon revocation, defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: TERMS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: Court ordered defendant pay a fine of $1,800 plus all applicable costs, fees and surcharges. Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Bail on deposit to apply.  Any balance owing to be paid over period of probation; remaining balance convert into civil judgment.  Upon revocation, any balance to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. No driving without valid license.
Cooperate with the Department. Cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary.
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession; Voting.
AODA assessment. Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J. Wartgow in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS,  with credit for 7 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years.  This sentence is stayed and defendant place on PROBATION for a period of 3 years.  Upon revocation, the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of Probation and extended supervision:
-12 months condition time in the HOC-forthwith; Huber for work, treatment and school conditional upon absolute sobriety--no EMS.
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-Cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary.
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Seek and maintain full time employment
-No driving without valid license
3 year revocation of driver license
3 year ignition interlock
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge from bail on deposit.  
The Court ordered defendant pay a fine of $1,800 plus all applicable costs, fees and surcharges from bail on deposit.  Any balance owing to be paid over period of probation; remaining balance convert into civil judgment.  Upon revocation, any balance to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Filed:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  kmw

Defendant Michael J. Wartgow in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 34.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-08-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J. Wartgow in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Hanna Kolberg for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 1/21/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  ALSO SCRAM.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Michael J. Wartgow in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Defendant Michael J. Wartgow in custody.  Nicholas S. Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
